page.shortlink: api sys shell result function source
page.description: Executes a 'command line' command and returns the result.

description.p: The program to run, including additional arguments for the program. Arguments used by the program are separated by space characters:
Returns any text output to stdout while running the program.

discussion.p: The *[xb:sys_shell_result()]* function runs an executable on the command line, returning the result of the execution. Unlike *[xb:sys_shell()]*, Alpha Anywhere waits until the *[xb:sys_shell_result()]* function finishes running before executing the next Xbasic statement in your script.

p.example: dim ipconfig_info as c ipconfig_info = sys_shell_result("ipconfig")
